thread.title: Marcus Rashford, Tom Davies and Ryan Sessegnon named in the top 30 Under-20s stars in Europe by Gazzetta dello Sport
thread.title_full: Marcus Rashford, Tom Davies and Ryan Sessegnon named in the top 30 Under-20s stars in Europe by Gazzetta dello Sport

author: dfraser
title: Marcus Rashford, Tom Davies and Ryan Sessegnon named in the top 30 Under-20s stars in Europe by Gazzetta dello Sport
text:
EFL Kids are alright Marcus Rashford, Tom Davies and Ryan Sessegnon named in the top 30 Under-20s stars in Europe by Gazzetta dello Sport 
Premier League trio make the list of best European youngsters, with Ousmane Dembele and Gianluigi Donnarumma at the top Feature Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments ENGLAND youngsters Marcus Rashford, Tom Davies and Ryan Sessegnon have been named in the top 30 Under-20s players in Europe. 
Italian outlet Gazzetta dello Sport called Manchester United wonderkid Rashford the fourth best in Europe, with the Everton and Fulham youngsters also making the list. Getty Images 7 Marcus Rashford is England’s highest-rated youngster at No4 in Europe 
The No1 youngster in Europe award goes to Borussia Dortmund ‘s French winger Ousmane Dembele , with AC Milan ‘s 17-year-old stopper Gianluigi Donnarumma coming in second. 
Keep up to date with ALL the football news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary. 
Bayern Munich ‘s Portuguese midfielder Renato Sanches comes in third with Monaco’s goalscorer from Tuesday night Kylian Mbappe coming in fifth, ahead of another Portugal man Ruben Neves. 
The top ten is completed by Malang Sarr, Kasper Dolberg, Breel Embolo and Mikel Oyarzabal. Marcus Rashford shows off with some remarkable skill in training PA:Press Association Everton's Tom Davies makes the top 30 after an impressive start to his career PA:Press Association 7 16-year-old Ryan Sessegnon is also in Europe's top 30 list 
England duo Sessegnon - the youngest player on the list - and Toffees man Davies came in 26th and 28th respectively, even ahead of Real Madrid 's Danish wonderkid Martin Odegaard (29). 
The Premier League's only other representatives are Chelsea 's on loan midfielder Jeremie Boga in 20th and Manchester City 's Enes Unal in 21st. 
Check out the full list of the top 30 and our profiles on the top ten, as well as our very own home-grown heroes, below... Everton youngsters Tom Davies and Ademola Lookman shine in easy win v Man City Cardiff 1-2 Fulham : Johansen and Sessegnon both score for Fulham in comfortable win 7 1. OUSMANE DEMBELE 
After one incredible season at Rennes, French winger Dembele is thriving at Borussia Dortmund, even earning three France caps in the process, aged just 19. 2. GIANLUIGI DONNARUMMA 
Dubbed the 'next Gianluigi Buffon', Donnarumma has been AC Milan's No1 for nearly two seasons already, at the age of just 17, as well as earning two Italy caps. 3. RENATO SANCHES 
One of Portugal's heroes at Euro 2016, Sanches earned his big-money move to Bayern Munich where he is set to become one of Europe's greats. Getty Images Ousmane Dembele is regarded as the most exciting prospect in Europe 4. MARCUS RASHFORD 
After bursting onto the scene last season, Rashford hasn't look back scoring goals for Manchester United for fun, as well as scoring on his England debut. 5. KYLIAN MBAPPE 
Already wanted by a host of Premier League clubs, including Tottenham and Liverpool, Mbappe has been finding the net with regularity at Monaco, including scoring against Manchester City on Tuesday. 6. RUBEN NEVES 
Portugal's second entry in the top ten, Porto midfielder Neves is a regular for his side - with a host of Europe's big names waiting to pounce. Getty Images Gianluigi Donnarumma is seen as Gianluigi Buffon's natural replacement 7. MALANG SARR 
On the brink of breaking into the France team, Sarr's rise has been rapid, already a first-team regular at high-flying Ligue 1 side Nice. 8. KASPER DOLBERG 
Already a Denmark international, Dolberg has been catching eyes at Ajax this season where he has scored ten times in just 21 league games. 9. BREEL MBOLO 
Switzerland international Mbolo was wanted by a host of European giants as he looked set to leave Basel, ultimately joining Schalke in the summer. Getty Images Renato Sanches joined Bayern Munich last summer 10. MIKEL OYARZABAL 
Aged just 19, Oyarzabal already has one Spain cap to his name as his performances for Real Sociedad - where he's a first-team regular - were too much to overlook. 26. RYAN SESSEGNON 
At just 16-years-old, there is a lot expected of the Fulham youngster who has played 14 Championship games already this season, scoring twice. 28. TOM DAVIES 
Davies has burst onto the scene at Everton this year, making 11 Premier League appearances and even scoring in the 4-0 demolition of Man City.
